intro: Smilax klotzschii, commonly known as the prickly pear or Florida smilax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Smilacaceae. It is a perennial vine characterized by its woody stems and spiny, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Smilax klotzschii is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
